description: From Middle English establissen, from Old French establiss-, stem of some of the conjugated forms of establir, (Modern French établir), from Latin stabiliō, stabilīre, from stabilis (“firm, steady, stable”).

verbs.description: establish (third-person singular simple present establishes, present participle establishing, simple past and past participle established)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make stable or firm; to confirm.
(transitive) To form; to found; to institute; to set up in business.
(transitive) To appoint or adopt, as officers, laws, regulations, guidelines, etc.; to enact; to ordain.
(transitive) To prove and cause to be accepted as true; to establish a fact; to demonstrate.
